hook.text: James Nachtwey has photographed every major conflict since the 1980s. He believes images can stop wars.

buildup.text: Nachtwey's work covers famine, disease, war, and injustice â€” always from dangerously close range.

discovery.text: His images are haunting and unflinching. A starving child, a burning building, a grieving mother â€” raw and real.

twist.text: He's been shot, beaten, and nearly killed multiple times. Each time, he went back. The story was more important.

climax.text: Nachtwey believes that if people see suffering clearly, they'll act to stop it. His camera is his activism.

punchline.text: He risks his life so others can see the truth.

quiz.question: What drives Nachtwey's dangerous work?
options: His belief that showing suffering can motivate people to stop it
